title: VEGOILS-Palm rises ahead of monthly data release, budget
text:
VEGOILS-Palm rises ahead of monthly data release, budget

KUALA LUMPUR, Oct 8 (Reuters) - Malaysian palm oil futures rose in early trade on Tuesday, set for a second day of gains, ahead of a monthly data release from the Malaysian Palm Oil Board (MPOB) and Malaysia's national budget announcement for next year.

The benchmark palm oil contract for the December delivery FCPOc3 on the Bursa Malaysia Derivatives Exchange was up 0.6% at 2,172 ringgit ($518.50) per tonne around 0310 GMT.

The MPOB will release data on palm oil inventories, exports and output for September on Thursday.

Meanwhile, Malaysia's government will likely present an expanded budget on Friday to temper a weak economic outlook, as it grapples with global recession fears, the protracted U.S.-China trade war and a large debt pile left behind by its predecessors. Malaysian palm oil stockpiles in September likely rose for the first time in seven months, as production grew and export demand eased for the edible oil, a Reuters survey showed. PALM/POLL

* Palm oil is due for a sharp move, as its consolidation within a wedge is ending, said Wang Tao, a Reuters market analyst for commodities and energy technicals. TECH/C

* U.S. corn futures edged higher on Tuesday to extend gains into a second straight session after the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) pegged the North American harvest pace behind market expectations. GRA/

* Oil prices rose on Tuesday, buoyed by overnight gains in industrial commodities, while unrest in oil-producing countries Iraq and Ecuador raised concerns of supply disruption, adding to support. O/R

MARKET NEWS

* Asian shares inched up in early trade on Tuesday, with investors cautious ahead of tense U.S.-China trade talks while the Turkish lira slipped over concerns about Ankara's planned incursion in northern Syria. MKTS/GLOB

* U.S. stocks eased on Monday as reports on the U.S.-China trade front kept investors cautious ahead of scheduled talks later in the week. .N

* The dollar found support on Tuesday while investors waited for an outcome from Sino-U.S. trade talks in Washington, with caution the catchcry as neither side showed any signs of giving ground at the negotiations. USD/

DATA/EVENTS AHEAD (GMT) 1200 Brazil IPCA Inflation Index MM
